trans-unit.source: By default, all requests to mobile service resources are restricted to clients that present the application key, which does not strictly secure access to resources.
trans-unit.target: By default, all requests to mobile service resources are restricted to clients that present the application key, which does not strictly secure access to resources.

trans-unit.source: To secure your resources, you must restrict access to only authenticated clients.
trans-unit.target: To secure your resources, you must restrict access to only authenticated clients.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, open your mobile service project, expand the Controllers folder, and open TodoItemController.cs.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, open your mobile service project, expand the Controllers folder, and open TodoItemController.cs.

trans-unit.source: The TodoItemController class implements data access for the TodoItem table.
trans-unit.target: The TodoItemController class implements data access for the TodoItem table.

trans-unit.source: Apply the following AuthorizeLevel attribute to the TodoItemController class.
trans-unit.target: Apply the following AuthorizeLevel attribute to the TodoItemController class.

trans-unit.source: This makes sure that all operations against the TodoItem table require an authenticated user.
trans-unit.target: This makes sure that all operations against the TodoItem table require an authenticated user.

trans-unit.source: You can also apply the AuthorizeLevel attribute at the method level.
trans-unit.target: You can also apply the AuthorizeLevel attribute at the method level.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) If you wish to debug authentication locally, expand the App_Start folder, open WebApiConfig.cs, and add the following code to the Register method.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) If you wish to debug authentication locally, expand the App_Start folder, open WebApiConfig.cs, and add the following code to the Register method.

trans-unit.source: This tells the local mobile service project to run as if it is being hosted in Azure, including honoring the AuthorizeLevel settings.
trans-unit.target: This tells the local mobile service project to run as if it is being hosted in Azure, including honoring the AuthorizeLevel settings.

trans-unit.source: Without this setting, all HTTP requests to localhost are permitted without authentication despite the AuthorizeLevel setting.
trans-unit.target: Without this setting, all HTTP requests to localhost are permitted without authentication despite the AuthorizeLevel setting.

trans-unit.source: When you enable self-hosted mode, you also need to set a value for the local application key.
trans-unit.target: When you enable self-hosted mode, you also need to set a value for the local application key.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) In the web.config project file, set a string value for the MS_ApplicationKey app setting.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) In the web.config project file, set a string value for the MS_ApplicationKey app setting.

trans-unit.source: This is the password that you use (with no username) to test the API help pages when you run the service locally.
trans-unit.target: This is the password that you use (with no username) to test the API help pages when you run the service locally.

trans-unit.source: This string value is not used by the live site in Azure, and you do not need to use the actual application key; any valid string value will work.
trans-unit.target: This string value is not used by the live site in Azure, and you do not need to use the actual application key; any valid string value will work.
